Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and the other animals or plants that live in the same habitat.
The student can label the habitat where the fish and other organisms live (e.g., lake, river, pond, or ocean).
The student can show and label what the fish needs to survive, such as water, food, and air (oxygen).
The student can represent and describe how the fish uses its habitat to meet its needs (e.g., swimming in water, eating smaller fish or plants).
The student can demonstrate how the parts of the ecosystem (fish, plants, water, etc.) work together to support life in that habitat.
